climbs.name: Shielded
climbs.fa: Unknown? (Possibly Colten, but if anyone knows please give credit)

content.description:
Starts matched in the obvious hole and moved up to the first shield before moving out right to the second shield. From there move straight up the dihedral using the arete and small edges.  Beautiful boulder, felt like some of the better climbing in the Cedar City area.

The grade is a guess, would welcome any and all opinions from anyone else who does this.
content.protection: Going to want a number of pads, 3-5, because the landing has quite a few small boulders.
content.location: First boulder you see when you pull into the campground area, the problem faces the parking area. Definition of a drive up boulder. Sagebrush shuffle is the boulder behind this one.

content.description: Pull onto slabby start with crimps and shuffle your way through vertical, balancy, movement. Perfect, just barely there, and super fun movement! Topout directly left of center apex above start. Grade is a guess. Strange problem.
content.location: Tallest rock near pavilion, swingset, and tire playground in campground.  Take a right at the Three Peaks sign and continue on gravel road until you are across from the pavilion and swings.  The climb is slab to vertical and varnished slightly orange on top of white granite.  Located at 37.770312,-113.171290 on the NE face of the boulder.
